column4: what file system partition is best for ubuntu and also compatible wit windows? ( an now installing it)
IdieOne would my windows partitionbe able to read from it

no.  But there are no partition types that Linux works on that Windows *can* read natively.  there's a third party ext3 driver that is pretty decent though.  On the flipside, Linux can read/write NTFS and fat32 (both windows filesystems)
